com.thales.dis.mobile.idcloud.auth.ui

Interface CommonUiCallback


  • public interface CommonUiCallback
    A callback that contains methods for managing authenticator selection and transaction confirmation.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAuthenticatorSelection(List<Authenticator> authenticators, UserChoiceCallback choice)
      Called during authenticator selection.
      void onTransactionConfirmation(TransactionContext message, UserConfirmationCallback confirmation)
      Called during transaction confirmation.

    • Method Detail

      • onAuthenticatorSelection

        void onAuthenticatorSelection(@NonNull
                              List<Authenticator> authenticators,
                              @NonNull
                              UserChoiceCallback choice)
        Called during authenticator selection.

        The developer should show authenticators to the user and let user choose which to use.

        This method will not be called if one of following condition is fulfilled:
        • There is only one authenticator option in the request.
        • There are two authenticators option; but system biometric is not enrolled. In this case, PIN authenticator will be selected.
        Parameters:
        authenticators - The list of authenticators to be selected.
        choice - The callback to handles the selection. It can also be used to cancel operation.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • onTransactionConfirmation

        void onTransactionConfirmation(@NonNull
                               TransactionContext message,
                               @NonNull
                               UserConfirmationCallback confirmation)
        Called during transaction confirmation.

        The developer should show message to the user and let user decide whether to accept the transaction.

        Transaction confirmation has timeout on which it waits for handler to be called. The timeout value is obtained by TransactionContext.getTimeout(). If the time elapses without any calls to confirmation, the operation will fail and any further call to confirmation will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        message - The transaction to be signed.
        confirmation - The callback to accept/reject/cancel the transaction.
        Since:
        1.0.0
